item.title: Does Mewgenics Have Controller Support? PlayStation & Xbox Controller Support On Steam, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The usual array of questions is being thrown at Mewgenics, as a Steam title. This includes wondering about its Steam Deck compatibility and if the game supports PlayStation and/or Xbox controller support.

Mewgenics needs to be enjoyed in any way possible. The cuddly yet catastrophically grim and violent cat-oriented strategy title has wowed everyone since its February 10 release, and if you’re looking to play it on Steam, controller support could be a sticking point.

Can You Play Mewgenics Using a PlayStation or Xbox Controller?

Mewgenics has complete PlayStation and Xbox controller support, and this has been verified and confirmed by its official Steam store listing.

Good news: If you want to play Mewgenics with a PS5 or Xbox Series X|S controller (or something adjacent), you can.

  • More Insider Gaming: Is Mewgenics on PlayStation, Xbox, or Switch? Console Release Date, Explained

There’s always an iffy element of can you/can’t you with games on Steam, even if they’re only available to buy on the platform. Some are only usable with a mouse and keyboard, as the configuration is easier to manage.

However, if you check the Mewgenics Steam page, you’ll clearly see a box in the right column saying ‘Full Controller Support,’ with Xbox Controllers and PlayStation Controllers listed, too.

Connecting a controller is easy, as you can do it either directly through a USB cable and looking for the device, or manually setting it up by connecting the controller and computer system using Bluetooth.

It’s as easy as training a cat, sort of.

Is Mewgenics Steam Deck Verified?

Steam Decks are compatible with Mewgenics, meaning you can play using your Steam console if you want.

A little bonus question answered for you: Steam Deck verification is A-ok for Mewgenics!

  • More Insider Gaming: Mewgenics Release Date Countdown & Exact Start Times

Again, you’d think it would be self-explanatory, but not all games have Steam Deck support. Mewgenics does, and that’s all that meowtters for this query.

Check out the Steam compatibility evaluation:

“Valve’s testing indicates that Mewgenics is Verified on Steam Deck. This game is fully functional on Steam Deck, and works great with built-in controls and display.”

It’s always good to get the IG community’s thoughts on things like this: Do you prefer using a controller for Steam games? Or are you part of the PC master race who settle for nothing less than a mouse and keyboard? Jot down your thoughts via the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

For something similar, check out if Hytale has controller support.

item.title: Today’s Strands #710 Hints and Answers for February 11, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #710 for Wednesday, February 11, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website. You can also play on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 11, 2026

The Strand’s answer for game #710 may drive you nuts. I was able to identify some of the theme words, the Spanagram, and several hint words. I used two hints.

General Strands Hints For February 11

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: The subtitle of today’s puzzle is Crack and Snack. However, you’re not thinking of just any snacks or even crackers.
  • Hint 2: The puzzle might drive you a little nutty, but don’t spend too much time thinking about the Planters mascot.
  • Hint 3: You might be able to roast these on an open fire, but you won’t be singing about it during the holidays.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #710 for February 11, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 11, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • NUTS
  • SAND
  • CAPE
  • LAND

  • CUTS

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #710 On February 11, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below.

  • FILBERT
  • PECAN
  • MACADAMIA
  • ALMOND
  • CASHEW
  • PISTACHIO
  • SPANAGRAM: GONUTS

If you solved today’s Strands without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #710?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 11 will be Strsnds Game #710.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

item.title: Helldivers Movie Release Date Revealed
item.content:encoded:
The Helldivers movie adaptation will reportedly be released on November 10, 2027, with more details revealed.

The Horizon Zero Dawn and Helldivers movies were announced back at CES 2025, and since then, we have received close to no new information. The director has spoken about their involvement in the movie and wanting A-listers to be ‘violently killed‘, but nothing else other than that. Now, we finally have a release date, a cast member, and a director.

Helldivers Movie Features Jason Momoa and Fast & Furious Director

A new report by Deadline reveals the release date for the Helldivers movie adaptation. Along with that, we were also informed that Jason Momoa, who plays Aquaman, will be part of the film. Additionally, Fast and Furious director Justin Lin will be at the helm for the upcoming adaptation. The film is being produced by Hutch Parker, PlayStation Productions’ Asad Qizilbash, and Lin through Perfect Storm Entertainment.

The last movie that we received from PlayStation Productions and Sony Pictures was the live-action adaptation of Uncharted, which featured Tom Holland and Mark Wahlberg. The movie grossed $407 million worldwide and became one of the top 10 highest-grossing video game adaptations. The duo has also worked on the Twisted Metal and The Last of Us series, and will join hands for adaptations of Horizon and God of War.

Talking about the God of War adaptation, it has secured actors for Atreus and Kratos. Additionally, here’s what you need to know about the Helldivers 2 Machinery of Oppression update. item.title: Pokémon Pokopia Features ‘More Things to Experience’ After End Credits
item.content:encoded:
The director of Pokémon Pokopia has revealed how many hours players would spend in the game and that experiences await after the end credits.

Pokémon Pokopia was announced for the Switch 2 during the Pokémon Presents showcase last year. Since then, we have received the March 4 release date for the title and a new trailer featuring Pikachu and Snorlax variants. Also, a leak has confirmed the theory about Pokémon Pokopia taking place in a post-apocalyptic world.Now, the developers have finally revealed some new information about the upcoming title.

Pokémon Pokopia Will be About 20-40 Hours Long

During a new interview with IGN, Pokémon Pokopia director Takuto Edagawa discussed the gameplay hours for the upcoming title and the experiences after the end credits. Edagawa explained that the title’s motive is “typically not to go to the end roll [credits].” The concept is to craft a world where you can spend your time with Pokémon.

However, on average, the title is expected to take 20 to 40 hours, though it really depends on how players approach it. Players will have “more things to experience after the end roll [credits].” The director believes players will be encouraged and motivated to keep playing the game after the end credits. Do you want more content, or does 20 to 40 hours seem enough?

In other news, Pokémon Fire Red and Leaf Green’s return has been teased by a leaker. Additionally, the developers have revealed how players on the original Nintendo Switch can join the fun, but there’s a catch.
